document.heading: District of Columbia Public Assistance Act of 1982 Conforming Amendments Amendment Act of 1989

history.narrative: Law 8-86, the “District of Columbia Public Assistance Act of 1982 Conforming Amendments Amendment Act of 1989,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-391, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 21, 1989, and December 5, 1989, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 21, 1989, it was assigned Act No. 8-136 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

meta.search-text: kwiktag" 103 203 823 AN ACT Enrolled Original Codification, District of Columbia Code (1990 Supplement) IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA O En _L_!989 To amend the District of Columbia Public Assistance Act of 1982 to conform to the requirements of the Family Support Act of 1988. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "District of Columbia Public Assistance Act of 1982 Conforming Amendments Amendment Act of 1989 Sec. 2. Title V of the District of Columbia Public Assistance Act of 1982, effective April 6, 1982 (D.C. Law 4-101; D.C. Code, sec. 3-205.1 et seq is amended as follows a) The second sentence of section 505(1 D.C. Code, sec. 3-205.5(1 is amended by inserting the word "not" after the word "shall b) Section 511 (D.C. Code, sec. 3-205.11) is amended as follows I) By amending subsection (a) as follows A) By amending paragraph (I) by striking the figure 75" and inserting the figure 90" in its place 2) By amending paragraph (2) as follows A) By striking the phrase 160 per month per child" and inserting the phrase 175 per month per child 2 years of age or over" in its place; and (B) By striking the phrase "a maximum of $120 if the individual has worked less than 120 hours in the month" and inserting the phrase "a maximum of $200 per month per child for a child under 2 years of age" in its place 3) By amending paragraph (5) as follows A) By striking the phrase "not already disregarded and (B) By inserting a new sentence after the Ist sentence to read as follows: Section 3-205.5 Section 3-205.11 n-rolled Oriilinal "The $30 plus one-third disregard for individuals found otherwise eligible will be applied before the disregards specified in paragaraph (2) of this subsection and after the disregard specified in paragraph (I) of this subsection and (4) By adding a new paragraph (5A) to read as follows 5A) Disregard any Federal Earned Income Tax Credit received Sec. 3. This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as provided in section 602(c)(I) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Code, sec. 1-233(c)(I and publication in either the District of Columbia Register, the District of Columbia Statutes-at-Large, or the District of Columbia Municipal Regulations.
